message.content:
cs.RO, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CV, cs.HC. 

The paper proposes a novel approach for a robot to acquire visuospatial skills for object manipulation tasks through demonstrations. This involves learning and generalizing multi-operation skills from a single demonstration, while requiring minimum prior knowledge about the objects and the environment. The paper also proposes a robot learning framework that integrates the proposed approach with imitation learning and a conventional planning method. Given the focus on robotics and machine learning, cs.RO and cs.AI are the most likely sub-categories. The use of point cloud processing techniques for 3D object manipulation tasks suggests cs.CV as a likely sub-category. The focus on user-friendly human-robot interaction suggests cs.HC as a possible sub-category. Finally, the use of a conventional planning method suggests cs.LG as a possible sub-category.
